intro: Arnoglossum incanum var. variegatum, commonly known as the variegated prairie gentian, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open prairies and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a variegated appearance with white or yellow markings. It is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms from late summer into early autumn.
